FuncDef:
The storm suppression command configures the maximum traffic rate in a VLAN.
The undo storm suppression command cancels the rate limit in a VLAN. The storm suppression command configures the maximum traffic rate in a VLAN. The undo storm suppression command cancels the rate limit in a VLAN. By default, the rate of broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast traffic is not limited in VLAN view.
CLIs: storm suppression { broadcast | multicast | unknown-unicast } cir <cir-value> [ gbps | kbps | mbps ] [ cbs <cbs-value> [ bytes | kbytes | mbytes ] ]
undo storm suppression { broadcast | multicast | unknown-unicast }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CIR in the unit of Gbit/s.

Specifies the committed burst size (CBS), which is the committed volume of traffic that can pass through.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295, in bytes.

Specifies the CBS in the unit of bytes.
-

Specifies the CBS in the unit of kbytes.
-

Specifies the CBS in the unit of Mbytes.
-

Specifies the committed information rate (CIR), which is the allowed rate at which traffic can pass through.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo: To rate-limit broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast packets in a VLAN and prevent broadcast storms, run this command in the VLAN view to configure traffic suppression for the corresponding type of packets. After this command is run, the device rate-limits broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast packets in the specified VLAN view and discards excess packets.
